Noelle Carter talks to chef Sean Brock about his new book, Heritage, Russ Parsons of the Los Angeles Times shares how to shop for olive oil, and Lynne Rossetto Kasper and Sally Swift trade ideas for easy holiday dishes. Artist David Ligare explains the relationship between food and gratitude in the ancient world, and the Sterns are at Bobke’s Bread Basket in Sierra Vista, Arizona.

contentencoded: Noelle Carter talks to chef Sean Brock about his new book, Heritage, Russ Parsons of the Los Angeles Times shares how to shop for olive oil, and Lynne Rossetto Kasper and Sally Swift trade ideas for easy holiday dishes. Artist David Ligare explains the relationship between food and gratitude in the ancient world, and the Sterns are at Bobke’s Bread Basket in Sierra Vista, Arizona.
description: Noelle Carter talks to chef Sean Brock about his new book, Heritage, Russ Parsons of the Los Angeles Times shares how to shop for olive oil, and Lynne Rossetto Kasper and Sally Swift trade ideas for easy holiday dishes. Artist David Ligare explains the relationship between food and gratitude in the ancient world, and the Sterns are at Bobke’s Bread Basket in Sierra Vista, Arizona.
title: Lowcountry Cooking
teaser: Noelle Carter talks to chef Sean Brock about his new book, Heritage, Russ Parsons of the Los Angeles Times shares how to shop for olive oil, and Lynne Rossetto Kasper and Sally Swift trade ideas for easy holiday dishes. Artist David Ligare explains the relationship between food and gratitude in the ancient world, and the Sterns are at Bobke’s Bread Basket in Sierra Vista, Arizona.
byline: Noelle Carter, Sally Swift and Lynne Rossetto Kasper
